titleStmt.title: Remarkable passages from Nottingham, Lichfield, Leicester, and Cambridge declaring what the Kings standard is, and the time and manner of its setting up. Also how Lichfield and Tamworth are disarmed, and the Lord Gray his house disarmed and pillaged by the traiterous cavaliers. Together with some other remarkable occurrents.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

A letter from a gentleman neere Nottingham, to a friend in London -- An information from Leicester -- From Lichfield -- An extract of a letter from an honest scholar of Cambridge, to one in Woodstreet, dated Aug. 30.
